critique: The document is an executive order focused on promoting exports to create jobs in the United States. It establishes an Export Promotion Cabinet and outlines various initiatives to support businesses, particularly small and medium-sized enterprises, in accessing international markets. The order emphasizes inter-agency coordination and aims to remove trade barriers, increase export credit, and promote U.S. goods and services abroad. There is nothing about immigration, civil liberties, or social issues. The order does expand executive power.
